This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.

## Supported versions

The CI uses a supported version for `0.7.3` [here](https://github.com/LayerZero-Labs/devtools/blob/main/packages/devtools-move/tasks/move/utils/config.ts#L345) but the CI runs at `0.7.2` [here](https://github.com/LayerZero-Labs/devtools/blob/main/Dockerfile#L179). 

This was not caught earlier because `examples/oft-initia` does not include `compile` does not include `com

prs.title: ci: detect unused function arguments with unparam
prs.truncated_body:
# Overview
Enables unparam, flagging unused arguments, and fixes violations. In most cases I renamed the argument to `_` instead of doing deeper refactoring.

To reproduce the warnings, apply the golangci-lint changes to origin/main and run `make lint`.

There is also some minor cleanup in this PR, updating a handful of comments and moving magic numbers into constants.

# Further Work

##

commits.message: ci: detect unused function arguments with unparam

prs.title: deps: Remove status-im/keycard-go
prs.truncated_body:
- This dependency was being used only to print hex-encoded bytes, but this can be done by passing `%x` to `fmt.Printf()`

`go mod tidy` has removed this as a direct dependency.

commits.message:
deps: Remove status-im/keycard-go

- This dependency was being used only to print hex-encoded bytes, but
  this can be done by passing %x to fmt.Printf()

prs.title: deps: Use stable slices package instead of experimental release
prs.truncated_body: - The adminserver.go file was using an experimental version of the slices package. This isn't necessary as the functions it uses are all available in the stable package.

commits.message:
deps: Use stable slices package instead of experimental release

- The adminserver.go file was using an experimental version of the
  slices package. This isn't necessary as the functions it uses are all
  available in the stable package.

prs.title: txverifier: fix nil deference panic for logs with no topics
prs.truncated_body:
- Adds handling for logs with no topics, fixing a panic in the code.
- Adds a unit test that passes a valid receipt with a log with no topics to ensure the code does not panic

An in-the-wild example of this occurring is the transaction 0xa3692c2469b2ac9e7010aa07e550a26f3f35a959e8c20b23fb0abc03d81e54b4

To test:
- Remove the new code in `node/pkg/txverifier/evm.go` and run the tests.

commits.message:
txverifier: fix nil deference panic for logs with no topics

- Adds handling for logs with no topics, fixing a panic in the code.
- Adds a unit test that passes a valid receipt with a log with no topics
  to ensure the code does not panic

An in-the-wild example of this occurring is the transaction
0xa3692c2469b2ac9e7010aa07e550a26f3f35a959e8c20b23fb0abc03d81e54b4

prs.title: fix: e2e cron test config
prs.truncated_body:
We are seeing constant failures on develop for this job: https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink/actions/runs/14650366838/job/41114880256

```
ERR No tests were run.
Error: Process completed with exit code 2.
```

### Changes

- Update the name of the cron tests to match that of the file: https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink/blob/develop/integration-tests/smoke/cron_test.go

prs.title: Remove dest token address padding from CCIP msg hasher
prs.truncated_body: The ccipevm is padding DestTokenAddress to 32 bytes, however this is not needed because the onchain should have already done it. This also causes problem because the e2e is not providing 32 bytes address and it blocks Solana on-chain validation [PR](https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink-ccip/pull/857).

commits.message: Padded dest token address for Solana2EVM token trasnfer E2E test

prs.title: [DX-591] CRE SDK doc review
[CAPPL-720] Refactor internal data structures
prs.truncated_body:
- Move from the Event interface to an Event struct
- Remove WorkflowRegistryEventResponse and ensure we handle a failure to convert the event correctly.
- Add a workflowRegistryEvent struct for use by the events based syncer; this contains the Event to send to the handler, plus specific metadata for use by events based syncing.
- Simplify event names by removing the WorkflowRegistry prefix.

commits.message:
[CAPPL-720] Refactor internal data structures

- Move from the Event interface to an Event struct
- Remove WorkflowRegistryEventResponse and ensure we handle a failure to
  convert the event correctly.
- Add a workflowRegistryEvent struct for use by the events based syncer;
  this contains the Event to send to the handler, plus specific metadata
  for use by events based syncing.

prs.title: fix: address encoding based on family
prs.truncated_body:
Encode address in view state.json based on chain family
When we don't know to which chain address belongs, we encode it with 64 bytes (evm needs 20 bytes, solana needs 64 bytes), so here is the proposed change

1) poolByTokens -> remoteChainConfigs
Now:
```
      "remoteChainConfigs": {
       (evm) "10344971235874465080": { 
        "RemoteTokenAddress": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAZJW1HtelJs095slXN

commits.message: fix: address encoding based on family

prs.title: [CAPPL-733] Engine V2 remaining limits
feat: add fire drill changeset
prs.truncated_body: This PR adds a changeset to generate firedrill proposals so teams can run exercises to test their signing tools and the health of the execution pipelines. The changeset generates a proposal for each chain on the addressbook with a NO-OP transaction. For now only solana, and EVM chain families are supported.

prs.title: Flaky ccip tests - Fix tooling issues
prs.truncated_body:
Enabled the RMN tests after applying the following fixes.

1) `changeset/testhelpers` added retry on `missing trie node` error while waiting for tx confirmation
2) `parrot` override the default container timeout that is used to wait for it to be ready
3) `rmn tests` fix replay-blocks test functionality that was not working as expected

NOTE that 1) and 2) might also be related to other test

commits.message: fix several issues that leaded to flaky tests

prs.title: Add some important logging to diagnose LogPoller issues

commits.message:
log when 0 events are found in a block we've requested

We only request blocks containing transactions sent to a program we are
tracking. So can only happen if we're calling some instruction
handler which doesn't emit an event.

prs.title: op-{program,supervisor}: Short-circuit inclusion check of expired msgs
prs.truncated_body:
This patch reduces the processing cost of expired messages in the supervisor by skipping database reads for expired messages.

More critically, it fixes a DoS vector in the Fault Proof by ensuring that the linear search for canonical blocks is bounded by the expiry window. Otherwise, it could be possible for an attacker to induce a fault proof that is too expensive to generate in a FPVM.

fixe

commits.message: op-{program,supervisor}: Short-circuit inclusion check of expired msgs
assert no-calls rather than return an error

prs.title: OPCM: ensure contract upgrade methods are called in opcm.upgrade
prs.truncated_body:
fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/14569

This scripts ensures that any contract within `packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L1/` with an upgrade function is called via it's contract/interface type by searching the OPCMUpgrader's upgrade function AST for this. It supports calls to any L1 
top level external upgrade call e.g
```
IContract.upgrade(...)
```
and internal ones

commits.message: add support for recursive search in nested statements/blocks, conditionals and loops
add support for try/catch blocks, modularize, add some tests
add support to catch upgrade calls within tenary and nested tenary statements
add justfile commands and improve test flexibility
add support for identifying upgrade calls done via the upgradeToAndCall function with a prespecified typeString
assert that the opcm base upgradeToAndCall fn has a call to proxyAdmins upgradeAndCall fn
support enforcing that abi.encodeCall is used with the expected contract and function types when using upgradeToAndCall internal call
update comment, add more test contracts

prs.title: feat(target_chains/ethereum): implement TWAP calculation directly in Pyth contract
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Migrated `calculateTwap` function from `PythUtils.sol` to `Pyth.sol` and removed the external dependency on `PythUtils` library. The function implementation remains identical but is now directly part of the Pyth contract.

## Rationale

- Reduces external dependencies by internalizing the TWAP calculation logic
- Simplifies deployment process by removing need to deploy and link

prs.title: CAP-0065 - Reusable module cache
prs.truncated_body:
This is the stellar-core side of a [soroban change to surface the module cache for reuse](https://github.com/stellar/rs-soroban-env/pull/1506).

On the core side we:
  1. Add a new mechanism to scan the live BL snapshot for contracts alone (which is a small part of the BL)
  2. Add a new wrapper type `SorobanModuleCache` to the core-side Rust code, which holds a `soroban_env_host::ModuleCache`

commits.message: Add helpers to extract CONTRACT_CODE entries efficiently from BL.
Support reusable module cache with multithreaded pre-compilation
Make test reporter robust against odd callback order (this happens)
Remove mistaken 'static' from LoadGenerator soroban state.
Bring XDR and soroban forward to MuxedAddress contract spec.
Tweak Makefile.am to support debug build profile.
Add tests for reusable module cache.
Record meta hashes for new tests
Address review comments and refresh p23 submodule

prs.title: test: Scope shard/realm first to target network, system properties
prs.truncated_body:
### **Background**

In order to effectively support intuitive configuration of nonzero shard/realm in hapi test networks, an extension of the hapi test framework that doesn't rely on a test scenario's specific use case is required. Therefore, this PR is the beginning of work needed to scope a configurable shard/realm to a hapi test network (specifically, the `HederaNetwork` interface).

prs.title: Fix `NullPointerException` on missing account key (0.128)
prs.truncated_body: Cherry-pick from #11000

commits.message:
Fix `NullPointerException` on missing account key (#11000)

In the consensus node there are no missing account keys in the state and if there are this is treated as a catastrophic failure. In a previous PR we added a default key for contracts. In this PR we add a default key for accounts. With this change we should be in sync with the consensus node. An integration test was added, as well as 2 junit tests that verify that the default account/contract keys are returned as expected.

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

prs.title: Move redelegation message to nondeterministic fees
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Move the Redelegation message to the nondeterministic message list. This change is necessary because, in an edge case, the validator may be in an unbonding state, leading to numerous redelegations and an escalating gas fee.    

# Reviewers checklist:
- [ ] Try to write more meaningful comments with clear actions to be taken.
- [ ] Nit-picking should be unblocking. Focus on co

commits.message: Move redelegation message to nondeterministic fees

Increase nondeterministic funds for staking test of redelegation

prs.title: refactor(observer): Replace Arc<dyn BlobReader> with Box<dyn BlobReader>
prs.truncated_body:
Resolves #4561.

- Added `clone_box` method to the `BlobReader`
- Updated `ObserverService::new` to require `Box<dyn BlobReader>` directly, removing the `Option` and default creation logic.

prs.title: refactor(ethexe): move block metadata persistence to ComputeService
prs.truncated_body:
Resolves #4551 .

Moves persisting block program states and schedule
from the `Processor` to the `ComputeService`.

- Modified `Processor` to return `BlockProcessingResult`
  containing states and schedule, removing direct DB calls.
- Updated `ComputeService` to receive `BlockProcessingResult`
  and call `set_block_program_states` and `set_block_schedule`.

@reviewer-or-team

commits.message: refactor(observer): Replace Arc<dyn BlobReader> with Box<dyn BlobReader>
refactor(ethexe): move block metadata persistence to ComputeService

prs.title: Native: revert Update/Deploy callflag change for pre-Aspidochelone
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/2653 changed required callflags of native ContractManagement's Update and Deploy methods from `States|AllowNotify` to `All`. This change didn't affect N3 mainnet/T5 (ref. https://github.com/neo-project/neo/issues/2673), but the problem is that this change affected NeoFS mainnet network (see https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/pull/2848 and h

commits.message:
Native: revert Update/Deploy callflag change for pre-Aspidochelone

https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/2653 changed required callflags
of native ContractManagement's Update and Deploy methods from
States|AllowNotify to All. This change didn't affect N3 mainnet/T5
(ref. https://github.com/neo-project/neo/issues/2673), but the problem
is that this change affected NeoFS mainnet network (see
https://github.com/nspcc-dev/neo-go/pull/2848 and commits description).

This commit fixes state difference between Go and C# nodes at height
451626 of NeoFS mainnet. Note that this commit does not affect existing
N3 mainnet/testnet states, so no resynchronisation is required on
update.

The difference itself:
```
go run scripts/compare-dumps/compare-dumps.go ./godump-echidna-neofs-mainnet/ ../../neo-project/neo/neo-cli-notary-mainnet/Storage_0572dfa5/
Processing directory BlockStorage_0
Processing directory BlockStorage_100000
Processing directory BlockStorage_200000
Processing directory BlockStorage_300000
Processing directory BlockStorage_400000
Processing directory BlockStorage_500000
file BlockStorage_500000/dump-block-452000.json: block 451626, changes length mismatch: 25 vs 11
compare-dumps dumpDirA dumpDirB
exit status 1
```

Go node application log for the problem transaction:
```
anna@kiwi:~/Documents/GitProjects/nspcc-dev/neo-go$ curl -d '{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1, "method": "getapplicationlog", "params": ["0x5028585a5c27b7f357771fa8b512c2d1b0ba40dcb3ea30e67d3db2d75d2da60d"] }' localhost:40332 | json_pp
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   592  100   450  100   142   461k   145k --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  578k
{
   "id" : 1,
   "jsonrpc" : "2.0",
   "result" : {
      "executions" : [
         {
            "exception" : null,
            "gasconsumed" : "900316660",
            "invocations" : null,
            "notifications" : [
               {
                  "contract" : "0xfffdc93764dbaddd97c48f252a53ea4643faa3fd",
                  "eventname" : "Update",
                  "state" : {
                     "type" : "Array",
                     "value" : [
                        {
                           "type" : "ByteString",
                           "value" : "r6jbcP2s5N7DIvRYS2ZiFdP7YXA="
                        }
                     ]
                  }
               }
            ],
            "stack" : [
               {
                  "type" : "Any"
               }
            ],
            "trigger" : "Application",
            "vmstate" : "HALT"
         }
      ],
      "txid" : "0x5028585a5c27b7f357771fa8b512c2d1b0ba40dcb3ea30e67d3db2d75d2da60d"
   }
}
```

C# application log for the same transaction:
```
anna@kiwi:~/Documents/GitProjects/nspcc-dev/neo-go$ curl -d '{ "jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 1, "method": "getapplicationlog", "params": ["0x5028585a5c27b7f357771fa8b512c2d1b0ba40dcb3ea30e67d3db2d75d2da60d"] }' localhost:50332 | json_pp
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   439    0   297  100   142   3502   1674 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  5226
{
   "id" : 1,
   "jsonrpc" : "2.0",
   "result" : {
      "executions" : [
         {
            "exception" : "Cannot call this method with the flag States, AllowNotify.",
            "gasconsumed" : "5684010",
            "notifications" : [],
            "stack" : [],
            "trigger" : "Application",
            "vmstate" : "FAULT"
         }
      ],
      "txid" : "0x5028585a5c27b7f357771fa8b512c2d1b0ba40dcb3ea30e67d3db2d75d2da60d"
   }
}
```

Signed-off-by: Anna Shaleva <shaleva.ann@nspcc.ru>

Native: move Update/Deploy callflags check to Management implementation

Make these checks implementation-specific in order not to affect the
general native invocation code. Ref.
https://github.com/neo-project/neo/pull/3909#pullrequestreview-2784113694.

Signed-off-by: Anna Shaleva <shaleva.ann@nspcc.ru>
